sentences.en: “If older cities are allowed to decay and contract, can citizens who vote with their feet . . . hope to find better conditions anywhere else?”(&b{Melinda Beck})
sentences.cn: “如果老城被允许崩溃并且缩小，用行动选择的公民能希望在别处找到更好的环境吗?”(&b{梅琳达·贝克})

sentences.en: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.cn: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.en: And of course we all know we can vote out our councillors.
sentences.cn: 当然，我们全都知道我们能投票罢免议员们。

sentences.en: Candidates deemed vote-worthy will be rewarded with campaign funds.
sentences.cn: 被认为有望获胜的候选人将会获得竞选资金。

sentences.en: George W. Bush carried the state with 56 percent of the vote.
sentences.cn: 乔治·W.布什在该州以56%的得票率获胜。

sentences.en: He walked to the local polling centre to cast his vote.
sentences.cn: 他走到当地的投票中心投了票。

sentences.en: Heck, if you don't like it, don't vote for him.
sentences.cn: 如果你不喜欢，不要投他的票不就得了。

sentences.en: I vote that you try to pick out the trail for us.
sentences.cn: 我提议由你来选我们该走哪条小路。

sentences.en: If he demands too much, the unions will vote him down.
sentences.cn: 如果他要求太多，工会就会投票撤换他。

sentences.en: In 1918 British women got the right to vote.
sentences.cn: 1918年，英国妇女获得了选举权。

sentences.en: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

sentences.en: Mr Gould called for a move towards "one man one vote"
sentences.cn: 古尔德先生号召采取“一人一票制”。

sentences.en: Of course, that would have to be by anonymous vote.
sentences.cn: 当然，那必须通过不记名投票的方式。

sentences.en: Once the vote was taken, things quieted down quickly.
sentences.cn: 一旦投完票，事情便很快平息了下来。

sentences.en: People with disabilities have got a vote as well, you know.
sentences.cn: 你知道，残疾人士也拥有投票权。

sentences.en: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.cn: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.en: Private polls and embassy reports pointed to a no vote.
sentences.cn: 私人民意调查和使馆报告表明投票结果将会是否决。

sentences.en: Should the General Synod vote women into the priesthood?
sentences.cn: 教会总会应该投票让女性担任教士吗？

sentences.en: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.cn: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.en: The vote passed with 111 in favour and 25 against.
sentences.cn: 111票赞成，25票反对，表决通过。

sentences.en: The vote was seen as a test run for elections to come.
sentences.cn: 这次投票被看作是即将到来的选举的预演。

words.tran_cn: 选举人，投票人；有投票权者
提议，使投票；投票决定；公认

phrases.phrase: vote of no confidence (或 vote of censure)

phrases.tran_cn: 用行动选择：用离开或进入一个特定地点的方式来表示选择或意见
(非正式)用脚投票；通过去或留等方式表明意见

trans.tran_cn: （选）票，投票（总数），表决，选举，投票/选举权
trans.tran_en: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote
to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

trans.tran_cn: 投票，表决，选举，公认，提议
trans.tran_en: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc
to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc
